alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Throckmorton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued March 31 at 2:12PM CDT until March 31 at 4:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Haskell County in west central Texas... Throckmorton County in west central Texas... * Until 415 PM CDT. * At 208 PM CDT, an area of dust was located from southwest of Haskell to east of Throckmorton. HAZARD...Near zero to one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. * Low visibilities are occurring on Highway 277 and Highway 380. Locations impacted include... Haskell, Stamford, Throckmorton, Irby, Elbert, Lake Stamford Marina, Paint Creek, The Intersection Of Us-183 And Us- 283 and The Intersection Of Us-380 And Highway 222. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
